article_title: Candidates Diverge Widely on Taxes, Growth and Lifting the Middle Class
article_text:
Presidential candidates of both parties say faster economic growth is crucial to giving middle-class families a raise. They disagree sharply about how to achieve it.

At the broadest level, the candidates divide by party, with Republican contenders following a formula dating to Ronald Reagan that says tax cuts and closing loopholes are the answer. On the Democratic side, the top response calls for increased spending, especially on...

twitter.description: Across the political spectrum, presidential candidates say faster economic growth is crucial to giving middle-class families a raise. They disagree sharply about how to achieve it—and whether growth alone is sufficient.
twitter.creator: @bobdavis187
